flourishing in the cup of his palm.
author: Stellah D.

description:
This place is WAY over-rated.  

Ok, the views are great.  The "painted ladies"  look much better on the picture, when you make the right cut.  The big building on the right side of the "ladies" really doesn't fit in.  

I would drive by with friends from out of town.  Maybe I would even want to go in for a few minutes to take some pictures for the album.  But I would NOT take my child there again, not in a million years.  

At first, I actually liked the views and the painted-ladies theme of the playground.  I thought it was kind of cool.  

However, as soon as we got near with my 3-years old, we saw a crowd of parents and kids hitting that mexian toy with a big stick, as a bunch of toddlers were curiously wandering around.  I had a hard time keeping my son away from them.   ARE YOU PEOPLE NUTS?  If you let your kids play a game like that, do it in your own back yard, or get a secluded section!!!  

Second, there are two or more gates, and people don't keep them locked.  Some kids would run out and go around, and if a child escapes, good luck catching up with him!  

The biggest slide is actually dangerous in the way it is designed.  It has an opening at the top, where kids can fall out and get hurt.  

The facilites are dirty.  Only some of the kids are supervised.  Most of the parents looked like the weirdest crowd of lower-height folks that you wouldn't normally invision as parents: pierced, greasy-haired, tatooed, lather-dressed punks.  And what do you expect, it is only steps away from Tenderloin and lower Height.

There are older kids who come and go, as they wish.  At one point I found my son playing with a much older kid and his "parent" in the sandbox.  I thought it was strange for a kid this old to play in a sandbox.  So, I leaned over to look.  The older kid's "parent" turned out to be an oversized teenager, and he had a super-sharp object in his hand that looked like an oversized tweezer.  They left, as soon as I leaned over.  And then I saw the oversized teenager was explaining his buddy how to hit someone with that sharp object.  What was his intention about my son or another baby?!  I asked the guy to put that thing away, and soon they left the playground.  I still wonder if I should have called the cops.  The most disturbing of it all was that everything was taking place in my plane view, and in the plane view of many other parents.  And I was the only one who told the teenager to put away that super-sharp scary object.

Anyway, I am so disgusted with this nasty little place.  Parents alert: stay away from this place with your kids, or watch them very closely.
author: LANA R.

description: I must admit, I was bummed out when I realized that this was the Full House park.  The thought of Mary-beth Olson and her lame-ass twin frolicking in vicinity (with Bob Saget supervising) just irked me.  I thought, that MUST be a different park, maybe the other square in Pac Heights.  The dozens of Yelp reviews MUST be wrong on this point.  They weren't, and I got over it.  This is an awesome park with awesome views to north and south.  I'm glad to have it in walking distance.
author: Leon R.

description: I think if I lived in SF I would be here everyday. The views are magnificent and of course the Full House house!!! The park wasn't crowded and there were lots of friendly dogs. I saw a group of people with all of their pugs and it made me miss my pug at home.  I also thought he would have been so happy there.  A great place for pictures and to just sit down and take everything in.
author: Glenn M.

description: Great dog park.!! I'm right in between the panhandle and this park. Actually, the panhandle is a little closer, but I prefer this park. It's farther away from traffic and it has a great view.
author: Lucy G.

description: This park is very cool, but it needs a few more patrols at night to keep the buttsex in the bushes down...
author: Tom S.

description: My Dog loves this park.  I love this park.  Sometimes I do feel bad though when I steal uncle Jesse's parking spot.
author: Brian B.

description: Definitely not a wilderness hill, Alamo Square hill is THE hill for Victorian house viewing, and for Victorian-house-viewing-tourist viewing. I love the stand of trees in the middle, and I love the grassy hill facing North, and I love the knobby bent tree at the Northwest corner.
author: Geronimo G.

description: This park makes the 21 bus ride to and from work enjoyable for about a block. A great place to drink after hours.
author: Danny D.

description: I can always find a needle here when I need one... Also, Kimmie Gibler hangs out at the corner of Steiner and Fulton every Tuesday and gives great ZJ's. What's a ZJ, you ask? We'll, if you don't know, you can't afford it!
author: Trevor J.

description: Go ahead, get it out of your system.  Pose with the Painted Ladies and downtown skyscape in the background.  Let your dog run around.  Avoid the occasional homeless guy.  You're right, it's pretty damned picturesque.
author: Eric S.

description: I brought my wife to this area for one reason..and thats to "everywhere you look ,everywhere you go(theres a heart)theres a heart" Give up...you guessed it to take a picture of the houses that come on the 90"s show full house.And it didnt  dissappoint.
author: Elijah Q.

description: Other than the Golden Gate Park, this has to be another touristy park. When i visited it, there was a tour bus driving away and a bunch of people taking pictures in front of the painted ladies (aka the Victorian & Edwardian houses). It's a great park for dogs, for picnics (there are picnic tables), for sunbathing and of course, for snapping pictures and admiring the SF view.
author: Janel Y.

description: I love this postcard perfect park, especially on one of those rare sunny and relatively warm SF days! I come here to play with other people's dogs, pretending they're my own because I'm not allowed to have one in my apt :( Not quite in the same vein, I also have some good memories of playing watchdog as my friend watered the trees after some good soju-infused fun in the valley of Hayes.
author: Natalie T.

description: close to home, filled with dogs, view of the city, and not as intense as Dolores. definitely gonna be lighting some things on fire here.
author: Ronny K.

description: I disappointed my sister by taking her here when she found out there were only 4 painted ladies... she disappointed me when she refused to reenact the opening scene to full house with me...
author: Valerie G.

description: I am just waiting for the day I run into DJ, Michelle, Stephanie, Joey, Danny, or Jesse.
author: Julie R.

description:
the city stops here. you sit on top of the hill watching the cars go by and its like time doesn't exist. usually its breezy so your hair gets in your face, but thats part of what SF is about. you really could sit forever. ever corner looks like a postcard moment.

most people just drive past not realising how beautiful this place is. take a moment and breathe in the city life. 

also, tennis courts and playground! weeeeeeee!!!!
author: Scarlet S.

description: Great views of the painted ladies and the SF skyline! This little park perched atop the hill is perfect for pictures and picnics. It's dog friendly. There's also a shoe garden - yes, a shoe garden by the restrooms. What's a shoe garden? Well, it's hard to describe and a little quirky...so go see it.
author: Mary R.

description: I have always loved this park, and probably always will.  I love the dogs, I love the flowers, i love the view...but then I got my own dog and learned a bit more about the park.  They fertilize the grass with something salmon flavored so my dog loves eating the dirt.  The dirt has feces traces in it and the feces often have diseases.  Now the lil pup can not kick the giardea he picked up in his first week there and it has been over 2 months.  Dont let your dog eat the dirt!  Otherwise it is a lovely place.  Say a prayer for poor little cowboy bob.
author: S M.

description: A restaurant that truly feels local.  I used to live only a few blocks away from Alamo Square and know that the only drawback is that the restaurant stand on "its own" without the company of close bars or other places nearby. I like the reasonably priced fish menu and good wine selection.
author: Cakes A.

description: Beautiful view, secluded and relatively unbusy tennis courts where I can be horrible & not embarrassed. Slightly windy (but not the tennis courts which are in a nice stand of trees) and can get quite cold. Great fun to play with all the dogs that bring their owners out there, and some of the owners are very cute. A great place to sit and read my book & listen to music if it's not wet out.
author: Heidi P.

description: First time I realized you can smoke herb pretty much ANYWHERE in SF was at this park...so...4 stars for that
author: Garrett C.

description: This place is as loud as a rock concert and as dim as a sex club. Otherwise, the food was pretty decent.
author: D'Andy C.

description: Beautiful. I lay in the grass under some eucalyptus trees on a recent warm sunny day, and totally blissed out. Quiet on the non-downtown-view side of the park, though of course the view is stellar. Don't miss the random "shoe garden" behind a small building (bathrooms, once upon a time?) in the middle of the park!
author: El K.

description: Another wonderful, sunny, friendly park to spend a day lounging on a blanket playing scrabble- which is what my bf and I did not too long ago. lol.. Yes, it is where the "Full House" houses are located, also known as the "Painted Ladies." It's beautiful here, especially when the locals walk their beautiful dogs. Last time I was here I saw a great dane, huskies..etc.. I love dogs. Anywho, this park is awesome. Come with the family and relive the Full house picnic that you always wish you did when you were a kid!! don't LIE! lol..
author: Je M.

description: I always try to stop by here with out of town friends for at least one photo-op. Sure they'll end up buy the post card version too but its always fun to walk the same spot the Olsen twins do in the opening credits of "Full House"
author: Quartknee K.

description: The view was great. I went to this park to take pictures;however, around 6pm you should leave. I was bitten by mosquitoes countless times.  And now it is swelling up, the mosquitoes ruin the experience at this park.
author: mike l.

description: it took me forever to find this park when i moved to the city (i refused to consult tour guides or look it up on the internet).  alamo sq is a beautiful park best known for its spectacular views of the city and the neighboring row of stately victorian houses (known as 'the painted ladies').  given it's proximity to the lower haight, alamo sq is a great place to lounge around until sunset and then walk over to haight and grab some beers at toronado!
author: Roshni R.

description: how the hell can you not like this park? great for dogs and great for reenacting the picnic scene where Michelle takes out the loaf of bread and sits on Bob Saget's lap. it's on a hill so you get a great view of the San Francisco skyline and its perfect for hill rolling. try to avoid of the turds.
author: Jordan A.

description: its a really nice park on a hill. you get to see an amazing view of the SF city and the houses ( painted ladies) which are very uniquely decorated.. reminded me of full house. =] visit the secret shoe garden! saw lots of people walking their dog.
author: Maria P.

description: okay, since the houses are on the cover of most of the tourist guidebooks, it wouldn't hurt to take a look.  yup, that's danielle steele's house.  click, click.  if you take the time to walk around the small park, you'll find a quaint shoe garden.  it's cute and unique.   other than that, it's mostly a park for dogs...maybe b/c it's too windy here to just hang out.
author: Immer E.

description: best park in the city, nuff said.
author: Pickle R.

description: our home away from home.  we go here with the dog 2 - 3 times every day and love it every time.  amazing old trees (that sometimes lose a branch or two!).  if you are not a dog person beware - few people follow the leash guidelines and there are some abandoned excrements from time to time.
author: David F.

description: if you've even heard of full house, you must visit this location to see the painted ladies.  the park itself has great views and you have to be pretty lucky to be able to take a pic of yourself without a ton of other people in your photo.  visit this location at night for a nice view as well.  if you walk to the bottom corner, you can see the civic center down the street.
author: Bryce K.

description: on one side of the hill it's a spot for my brown baby to get his park on and on the other a breezy sunny spot for me to read, relax and have a spectacular view of my beloved san fran...and I heard that in the middle is  an awesome patch of shrubberies for gay boys to do the wild thing!!!!
author: hungry b.
